ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Rachel Holmes
Rachel Holmes
Rachel Holmes
Rachel Holmes

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Professors Tucker and Grim have the vastest knowledge on world religions and ecology and their class discussion is the best opportunity to think and discuss about this subject.
The instructors. They are rock stars.
That it was discussion based, so we learned a lot not only from our instructors but also from our fellow classmates as well, which allowed us to share our different backgrounds and viewpoints.
The opportunity to participate in the class discussions with total freedom and expressing all points of view.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I think I would have prefered a research paper to a final exam. A paper would have allowed me to get more in depth with the material. Maybe make graduate students write a research paper and undergraduates take the final exam?The class was a little big. The room was too small for the class. This is not an undergraduate class and there were a lot of undergraduates. I think it's fine to have undergraduates if there is space for them, but the class was already big. I'm surprised that the university lets undergraduates take any graduate classes they want. But as a graduate student, I'm not allowed to take some of the undergraduate classes.I was not the biggest fan of the time of the class. I would have prefered it to be a morning or early afternoon class. 3:30 - 5:30 is the time of day when I am most tired and hungry. I got sick two times during class. But this is just how I am and others may function best at this time of day.
I don't think the class needs improvement.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: They were all very approachable and always available.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I was really interested in the subject. It was frustrating that the FES MEM curriculum made it very difficult to take courses like this. Perhaps FES should offer an MA so that people can take more humanities oriented courses.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To gain a more solid philosophical foundation for environmental policy-making
I took it because I was interested in the subject, had a background in East Asian literature and knew the instructors has great reputations.
This course was an elective. I took it because it gave me the opportunity to think about environmental subjects from a different perspective and to improve my analytical skills.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes, and more.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I would advise anyone to take this class although it may not fit with their main field of interest, because the instructors are great and the course offers a different viewpoint to environmentalism.
